prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional, Rectangular Prism with a Curved Top and Flat Bottom** **Step 1: Create Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system centered on a white background. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. This will ensure the part is aligned with the origin of the coordinate system. **Step 2: Draw 2D Sketch** Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane. The sketch consists of one face (face\\_1) with one loop (loop\\_1). loop\\_1 is a closed loop constructed with four lines and two arcs. * line\\_1 starts at [0.0, 0.0] and ends at [0.375, 0.0]. * arc\\_1 starts at [0.375, 0.0], has a midpoint at [0.6402, 0.1098], and ends at [0.75, 0.375]. * line\\_2 starts at [0.75, 0.375] and ends at [0.75, 0.75]. * line\\_3 starts at [0.75, 0.75] and ends at [0.375, 0.75]. * arc\\_2 starts at [0.375, 0.75] has a midpoint at [0.1098, 0.6402], and ends at [0.0, 0.375]. * line\\_4 starts at [0.0, 0.375] and ends at [0.0, 0.0]. Note: This loop forms the perimeter of the rounded rectangular base that will be extruded to form the final shape. **Step 3: Transform into 3D Sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. This will change the loop coordinates but not the loop structure. The new loop will still retain the same relative dimensions and orientation. **Step 4: Extrude Sketch** Extrude the scaled 2D sketch along the normal by a distance of 0.1875 units. This will generate a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a curved top and a flat bottom. The top and bottom edges of the prism are rounded, and the sides are straight. The object is centered on a white background. The final shape has a length of 0.75 units, a width of 0.75 units, and a height of 0.1875 units. Given the CAD Assembly JSON, this completes the instructions to construct Part 1.</description>
